title: Western Province bans private tutoring by school teachers
byline: The Western Province Education Zonal Ministry has issued a circular prohibiting private tutoring classes for students by school teachers.

title: Do not organise school programmes disturbing Sunday school activities: Ministry
byline: The Education Ministry has instructed all government schools not to organise various programmes on Sundays, as they may disrupt Sunday school activities.

title: Barath Arulsamy appointed vice president of Democratic People’s Front
byline: The Democratic People’s Front (DPF), a prominent member of the Tamil Progressive Alliance and a key partner of the Samagi Jana Balawegaya coalition, appointed Barath Arulsamy as the party’s new Vice President.

title: Former govt’s hard work now yielding strong, tangible results: Semasinghe
byline: The former government’s collective hard work and determination in steering the nation from crisis to growth are now yielding strong, tangible results, former State Minister of Finance Shehan Semasinghe said.

title: Special traffic operation from tomorrow
byline: An island-wide traffic operation will be launched tomorrow to inspect passenger buses during the festive season, the Police Media Division said.

title: Chinese ship ‘Peace Ark’ to stay in Colombo till December 28
byline: The Chinese People’s Liberation Army Navy hospital ship ‘Peace Ark’ arrived in Colombo on a formal visit yesterday.

title: Over 2,000 die in road accidents this year alone
byline: A total of 2,243 people have died in road accidents this year, police said.

title: Nine-year-old among five killed in attack on German Christmas market
byline: A nine-year-old child and four adults have been killed after a car drove into a crowd at a Christmas market in the eastern German city of Magdeburg.

title: People have complete right to lie: Kottahachchi
byline: People have the complete right to convince others that something true is false or something false is true, as it is a democratic right, NPP MP Nilanthi Kottahachchi said today.

title: Three killed in bus accident
byline: Three people have died and at least 30 others injured in an accident that occurred this morning (21) when a bus veered off the road on the Hatton-Kandy main road.

title: Lotus Tower extends operating hours till January 2
byline: The Colombo Lotus Tower Management Company (Private) Limited has announced extended operating hours for the festive season.

title: Over 90% of SL’s major disasters due to meteorological phenomena
byline: The Department of Meteorology in a press release mentioned that Sri Lanka experiences more than 90% of its major disasters due to meteorological phenomena, with dozens of incidents occurring annually as a result of torrential rainfall.

title: SL exits ’Restricted Default’ rating
byline: Fitch Ratings has upgraded Sri Lanka’s Long-Term Foreign-Currency Issuer Default Rating (IDR) to ’CCC+’, from ’RD’ (Restricted Default).

title: Western province leads economic contribution to 2023 GDP with 43.7% share
byline: The Western province continued to lead the provincial gross domestic product (GDP) in 2023, albeit slipping from the 2022 levels while the North Western and Central provinces following as the distant second and third in the provincial distribution of Sri Lanka’s total economic output.

title: Government hoping to update FTA with India: Vijitha
byline: The government is hoping to initiate discussions with India to update the Free Trade Agreement between India and Sri Lanka, which was signed several decades ago, Foreign Minister Vijitha Herath said.

title: Halt harmful wildlife practices, adopt scientific solutions: CEJ urges President
byline: The Centre for Environment Justice (CEJ) urged President Anura Kumara Dissanayaka to immediately halt informal practices across the island that harm wildlife and to adopt a scientific approach to environmental management.

title: Shooting incident in Galle leaves one dead
byline: A person who was killed in a shooting incident in Dadalla, Galle today, the police said.

title: President hints at time period for LG, PC polls
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake said that the Local Government elections are expected to be held before the Sinhala and Tamil New Year in 2025.

title: Cassilingham slams Govt. for following Ranil’s footsteps
byline: Geethanath Cassilingham, the Jaffna District Chief Organizer of the Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP), criticized the current government for failing to deliver on the promises it made during the election.

title: New national convenor appointed for SLPP
byline: MP D.V. Chanaka has been appointed as the Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) new National Convenor.

title: Mobile phones, laptops worth Rs. 50 Mn seized at BIA
byline: Customs officials at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA), Katunayake arrested three individuals attempting to smuggle electronic devices worth Rs. 50 million into Sri Lanka.

title: Misuse of President’s Fund: Dayasiri responds to allegations
byline: MP Dayasiri Jayasekera has rejected allegations that he improperly benefited from the President’s Fund.

title: Govt. defends Ex-Ambassador Arunatilaka
byline: While standing by former Deputy High Commissioner of Sri Lanka in Canberra Himalee Arunatilaka, who faced a lawsuit over a salary issue of a domestic aide, Foreign Minister Vijitha Herath said Arunatilaka had not committed any financial fraud and that it was due to an issue with Sri Lankan salary scale.

title: Notorious underworld figure ‘Kudu Salindu’ granted bail
byline: Salindu Malshitha Gunaratne, alias ‘Kudu Salindu,’ a notorious drug kingpin and underworld figure, was granted bail by the Panadura Magistrate’s Court today.

title: Hybrid vehicle import tax based on engine capacity will reduce costs, satisfy all
byline: If hybrid vehicle imports are taxed based on their engine capacity, it will satisfy both consumers and the government, while reducing the prices of existing vehicles in the country, President of the Sri Lanka Business Council of Japan Jagath Ramanayake said.

title: Malaysia to resume search for missing MH370 plane
byline: Malaysia’s Cabinet has agreed to a proposal to launch a new search for Malaysia Airlines flight MH370, which disappeared mysteriously 10 years ago, the Transport Minister said today.

title: Lanka T10 match-fixing scandal: Indian team owner granted bail
byline: The Colombo Chief Magistrate granted bail to Indian national Prem Thakur, the owner of the ‘Galle Marvels’ team in the Lanka T10 Super League Tournament, on heavy bail conditions.

title: SLC reduces voting members from 147 to 60 ahead of 2025 elections
byline: Ahead of the 2025 Sri Lanka Cricket (SLC) elections, SLC said that its membership at an extraordinary general meeting has decided to reduce the number of voting members from 147 to 60.

title: IMF to assess Sri Lanka’s tax revisions in upcoming staff report
byline: The IMF Executive Board is expected to convene in the coming months to review the Staff-Level Agreement on the Third Review under the Extended Fund Facility (EFF) arrangement between Sri Lanka and the IMF.

title: Government to appoint committee to draft national policy on research vessels: Foreign Minister
byline: The government is to appoint a special committee to prepare a policy framework on foreign research vessels entering Sri Lankan waters, Foreign Minister Vijitha Herath said today.

title: Can funds disbursed through President’s Fund be refunded?
byline: In the wake of the recent revelation of politicians receiving money from the President’s Fund, many have questioned whether such disbursed funds can be refunded.

title: Selfie turns fatal: Two women killed by train
byline: A female student and another woman were killed after being struck by an express train at the Anuradhapura New Town Railway Station.

title: Special security measures for Churches holding Christmas services
byline: Special security measures will be enacted by the Police and tri forces for all churches across the country holding Christmas services.

title: First overhauled Kfir jet to join SLAF fleet by early 2025, as part of $50Mn upgrade
byline: The Sri Lanka Air Force (SLAF) is set to add one of its overhauled and upgraded Kfir multirole combat aircraft to its fleet within the first three months of next year, the Daily Mirror learns.

title: Is Israeli soldier known as ’terminator’ in Colombo? Police respond
byline: In response to widespread concerns regarding the alleged presence of Israeli soldier Gal Ferenbook in Colombo, police said that they have not received any verified information on the matter.

title: Licence ready, Elon Musk’s Starlink yet to import devices to start operation
byline: Despite Elon Musk’s Starlink, the satellite unit of SpaceX, being granted licence to operate in Sri Lanka, the organization is yet to apply for the import of devices to be used in connecting to the service, a top source said.

title: “I will be going to China mid next month”; President
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake will travel to the island’s largest bilateral lender China for talks in January, he said on Saturday, days after completing a long-delayed foreign debt restructure.

title: November merchandise exports slide 5.6% YoY while services sector expands 21%
byline: Sri Lanka’s export performance for the month of November witnessed a Year-on-Year (YoY) contraction of 5.6 percent with revenue reaching US$ 943.1 million.

title: Tri-forces security of former Presidents to be removed from today
byline: The tri-forces security provided to former Presidents will be removed from today as announced by Public Security Minister Ananda Wijepala.

title: Man injured in daylight shooting
byline: A 30-year-old man was injured in a shooting by two unidentified assailants who arrived on a motorcycle in Koskandawala, Weeragula this afternoon.

title: Sri Lanka Cricket names squad for New Zealand ODI series
byline: The Sri Lanka Cricket Selection Committee has named a 17-member squad for the upcoming ODI series against New Zealand.

title: CSE hits new high as ASPI goes over 15,000
byline: The All Share Price Index (ASPI) of the Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) surpassed 15,000, hitting a record of 15,027 during mid-morning trading.

title: 50 elephants dead due to electrocution so far this year: CEB
byline: Some 50 elephants have died due to unauthorised connection of the CEB’s electricity supply to fences or wires so far in 2024, the Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) said.

title: School third term to begin on January 2, 2025
byline: The Ministry of Education announced that the second stage of the third term for the 2024 academic year in all government and government-approved private schools will commence on January 2, 2025.

title: Explosive batsman Jacobs gets New Zealand call-up for Sri Lanka series
byline: Hard-hitting New Zealand batsman Bevon Jacobs earned a maiden call-up Monday for their T20 series against Sri Lanka, which marks the start of Mitchell Santner’s tenure as white-ball captain.

title: Main schools in Colombo without principals
byline: Some seven schools in Colombo including Royal is running without principals currently, the Education Ministry said yesterday.

title: Economic crisis stalls five high-rise buildings
byline: Construction work of five high-rise buildings have been ground to a standstill because of the economic crisis that hit the country in 2022, and the Ministry of Urban Development is now at a loss to decide how to resume them since the project companies have either been declared bankrupt or mutually terminated projects, a top source said.

title: India to play Champions Trophy games in Dubai
byline: Dubai has been chosen as a neutral venue for India to play their matches at next year’s Champions Trophy, the Pakistan Cricket Board has announced.
